item.title: How to code review?
item.description: In most cases, do not make code review mandatory. When people can deploy, they own it. When people own it, they care for it. You should comment.

item.title: How to test code?
item.description: Remember that you have to maintain tests. Keep code simple. Keep tests simpler. Avoid abstractions in code. Ban them in tests.

item.title: How to write a git commit message?
item.description: Limit the subject line to 50 chars. Write like youâ€™re giving orders. Start with a verb. One line often suffices. Limit the body lines to 72 chars.

item.title: How to debug anything?
item.description: Be great at debugging. Read the error messages. Start from the last message. Hidden in the noise, you may find the solution. Stay calm.
